intro: Erigeron zothecinus, commonly known as the clustered fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy, gray-green foliage. Its flowers bloom in late summer, producing white to pale purple petals surrounded by ray florets. Erigeron zothecinus is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it thrives in full sun.
